subject: RE: [junit] nightly build feature
msgSnippet: Yes, that is a difference.  My observation is that Pragmatic Programmer¡¯s Bookshelf books at Amazon are in most cases available for about 30% less than
messageBody:
Yes, that is a difference. My observation is that Pragmatic Programmer’s Bookshelf books at Amazon are in most cases available for about 30% less than directly from the publisher. But that seems to be the case for many books.



Andreas



________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Cédric Beust ?
Sent: Sunday, July 09, 2006 7:17 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] nightly build feature



On 7/9/06, Craig Demyanovich <demmer12@... <mailto:demmer12%40fastmail.us> > wrote:
>
> On Jul 7, 2006, at 7:11 PM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > didoss@... <mailto:didoss%40comcast.net> wrote:
> > >
> > >
> > > Write tests and code,...write an Ant script to run all the
> > > tests,...schedule the ant script to run nightly.
> >
> > If I had to start a Java project with /just one book/, I'd choose this
> > one: http://tinyurl.com/jp643 <http://tinyurl.com/jp643>
> >
> > And no, I didn't write it.
> Joe's recommendation is a good one; the book is fantastic! However,
> I'd go the source to get it:
>
> http://pragmaticprogrammer.com/starter_kit/auto/index.html <http://pragmaticprogrammer.com/starter_kit/auto/index.html>

Mmmh... $33 "at the source", $19 at Amazon...

--
C�gic
http://testng.org <http://testng.org>
